intro: Dipelta yunnanensis var. brachycalyx, commonly known as the Yunnan dipelta, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, umbel-like inflorescence. The plant features finely divided, aromatic leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
